meanings.definition: The quality or state of being irresistibly attractive or captivating.
meanings.sent1: Her smile had an irresistibility that drew everyone to her.
meanings.sent2: The movie's irresistibility made it impossible to look away.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's irresistibility was so strong that even the grumpiest person couldn't resist petting it.
meanings.sent4: The song's irresistibility was like a magnet, pulling people to the dance floor.
meanings.sent5: The cake's irresistibility was evident by how quickly it disappeared at the party.

meanings.definition: The power to attract or hold the attention of others.
meanings.sent1: The speaker's irresistibility kept the audience engaged throughout the entire presentation.
meanings.sent2: The book's irresistibility made it hard to put down.
meanings.sent3: The magician's irresistibility was so strong that even the skeptics were amazed.
meanings.sent4: The painting's irresistibility seemed to make time stand still for those gazing at it.
meanings.sent5: The actor's irresistibility on stage left the audience in awe.
